channel.title: Debugging C programs :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: gdb is the C debugger. It allows you to create an executable specifically for debugging purposes. Getting gdb First, ensure that you have gdb installed. gdb on Windows Type in a terminal: gdb --versionIf you see a version number, then you already have gdb installed. If you see an error that gdb is unrecognized, you will need to install it. Launch a MSYS2 prompt (Windows icon->type MSYS2) and then type the following in MSYS2:
